attributes.review: This game is profoundly amazing. every-time I open it up, I find myself questioning what I have done in my life, and what more I want to do. This game has taught me to love again, and I hope it does that same for you.
attributes.title: This game inspired me to do better

attributes.review: I downloaded it because I saw $2.99 for "unlock everything" and I thought "that's fair". But after opening the app, I can't purchase it (it was probably a leftover from pre-subscription era) and the only option is a subscription where the same amount gives you a week of gameplay. That's $150 a year, which will give you original Cards Against The Humanity with *all* the expansions. No Kristian, your app isn't worth this much and jumping on the subscription band wagon won't help.
attributes.title: Good app but the pricing is too greedy

attributes.review: I hope the developers step on a logo for the rest of their lives. This game is not worth the cost of the subscription so I‚Äôm pretty sure they make money on people who download, subscribe, and then forget to cancel. They charged me 10 dollars a week for a month until I checked in on my subscriptions and saw all the money coming out. I‚Äôm so tired of this business model. Just let people pay to get the app. Not everything needs to be a subscription.
attributes.title: One of those subscription scams

attributes.review: I love this app. It made a party that i went to better than I expected. It exposed me, my friends, and my girlfriend. I would recommend this game because it does have some inappropriate cards, there are quite a bit of normal clean cards.

attributes.review: I think this is a really good game to have with a lot of friends or even just one. Because the answers are so random that everyone would get messed up (drink responsibly though). 10/10 would recommend.
